item.title: Why Telephone Wiring is a Thing of the Past
item.description:
The traditional telephone network, known as POTS (Plain Old Telephone Service), utilizes a vast network of thin copper wires connecting buildings to local telephone exchanges. This system, designed solely for analog communication, efficiently serves businesses using traditional phones and low-speed devices like fax machines. Imagine two parallel road systems: high-speed freeways representing computer networks and slower county roads symbolizing the telephone network. Coexisting within the same regions, each serves distinct traffic needs...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-telephone-wiring-is-a-thing-of-the-past/
